title: Sexylizzy2813
author: Sexylizzy2813
content: Man Utd have reacted to Ronaldo's interview with Piers Morgan by issuing a press release. The club are keeping their cards close to their chest for now but reports have suggested that they are extremely unhappy with the situation.This was published on their official website and it reads;"Manchester United notes the media coverage regarding an interview by Cristiano Ronaldo, the club will consider its response after the full facts have been established. Our focus remains on preparing for the second half of the season and continuing the momentum, belief and togetherness being built among the players, manager, staff, and fans."The statement comes less than a day after clips of Ronaldo's interview with Morgan emerged on social media, with the veteran forward expressing his displeasure at the current state of Manchester United. As well as taking aim at manager Erik ten Hag, the Portuguese superstar also criticised former boss Ralf Rangnick.https://www.goal.com/en/news/man-utd-club-statement-cristiano-ronaldo-interview/blt1f4b90741f8beade

comments.author: Captain Corporate
comments.body: I mean Ronaldo literally said that the owners did absolutely nothing for the club, he said there were a lot of people who didn't want him there, and he said he doesn't respect the manager. I do not really see how he can stay, if it was just between him and the manager, maybe there could have been some way of figuring it out, but he outright told the owners off on national television as well, there is absolutely no way of coming back from there. He is not going to get ANY playing time if you ask me, and if he does then the manager doesn't have any self respect. He will probably be let go after world cup, and he will be asked to find a team asap. Thats the type of situations we are in, there is no future for Ronaldo in United at all.

comments.author: BitcoinAccepted
comments.body: Most of us will have seen or heard about the interview. I think United are also guilty of it themselves, they have not really treated Ronaldo with respect. This is not just any one player, this man has been the best football player in the world a few times. And has meant a lot for football worldwide. That is not well estimated by Erik Ten Hag. It is clear that Ronaldo has indicated that he does want to leave United (indirectly). It is quite serious accusations to say that the management of the club and the coach do not want you at the club. Surely there must be a grain of truth in there somewhere?

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Christiano Ronaldo might be one of the G.O.A.Ts in modern day football but nobody is bigger than the team(and the club as a whole).He can criticize whoever he wants. He can criticize Manchester United owners, if he wants. Expressing an opinion isn't wrong by itself.The problem is that Ronaldo thinks that he is as big as Manchester United. He obviously doesn't want to solve his personal issues with Ten Hag and he doesn't want to solve his issues with his teammates. Maybe it's time for him to leave United and finish his career in the USA. He doesn't add any value to this team anymore.

comments.body: If 10 people are asked where Portugal is on the world map, 9 out of 10 people will show the country's position thanks to Ronaldo. Shame on the players who acted against Ronaldo in the Portuguese national team, especially Manchester United, after giving this example. What is this attitude of Bruno Fernandes? You have no right to react to a football player who has successfully represented your country for years. If Manchester plays such a football, Bruno is among those responsible for it. After seeing such behavior, I will no longer support MANU, which I have supported for years. No one can do this to a football player who has become a world legend.
